abstract: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is trying to determine if the model from the defunct General Motors division should have been recalled in an earlier action.
snippet: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is trying to determine if the model from the defunct General Motors division should have been recalled in an earlier action.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Saturn Division of General Motors Corp

lead_paragraph: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is a step closer to concluding that General Motors should have recalled 384,000 Saturn Ions in 2010 as part of a larger recall that covered one million Chevrolets and Pontiacs for a steering problem.

headline.main: Government Deepens Investigation of Saturn Ion for Steering Problem
